source: IV Crush Patterns Database - Historical Analysis
description: Historical IV crush patterns around earnings for common tickers

mega_cap_tech.typical_iv_increase: 40-80% above baseline in week before earnings

strategy.profitable: Sell ATM strangles/iron condors 1-2 days before earnings
strategy.avoid: Buying options day before earnings (IV premium too high)
strategy.sizing: Max 2% of portfolio per earnings play

strategy.profitable: Iron condors with wider wings (expect larger moves)
strategy.sizing: Max 1% of portfolio - these can move 15%+ overnight

strategy.avoid: Strangles (not enough IV premium to be worth risk)
strategy.sizing: Up to 3% of portfolio - lower volatility

timing_rules: IV typically starts rising 5-7 days before earnings
Peak IV occurs 1-2 days before announcement
IV crush happens overnight - position must be closed by EOD before earnings
Post-earnings IV settles to new baseline within 2-3 days
Earnings during high VIX (>25) see less crush - already elevated
risk_factors: Guidance matters more than earnings beat/miss
Large moves can exceed expected move (iron condor wings breached)
After-hours announcement = can't adjust until market open
Binary outcome: IV crush helps BUT direction can still hurt

expected_move_formula.example: AAPL at $180, ATM straddle costs $9 = 5% expected move
expected_move_formula.usage: Set iron condor wings outside expected move for higher win rate

high_iv_rank_above_50.target: Close at 50% profit or day before earnings

uncertain_direction.target: Max profit if stock pins at strike
